name: Healed by Jesus Quiz | New Testament | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which disciple's mother-in-law did Jesus heal, as told in all three of the synoptic Gospels?
questions.explanation:
Peter.

	Peter's mother had a fever. When Jesus touched her she sat up and the fever was gone. This can be found in Matthew 8:14-15, Mark 1:29-31 and Luke 4:38-39.

questions.text: According to the King James Version, where was the deaf-mute from that Jesus healed?
questions.explanation:
Decapolis.

	Jesus healed the man by sticking His fingers in the man's ears. The man could speak a little but it was so little he was considered a mute. This story can be found in Mark 7:31-37.

questions.text: According to the King James Version, Jesus healed a few blind men. What question was asked about the one blind from birth?
questions.correct: Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
options: So, Jesus, can you restore his sight or not?
Why was he born this way, Rabbi?
Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
Teacher, there's no hope for him, is there?
questions.explanation:
Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?.

	Jesus responds in John 9:3 "Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him. " The whole story is found in John 9:1-12. This is the section of the Bible where Jesus calls Himself The Light of the World.

questions.text: How many years was the man lying by the pool of Bethesda paralyzed, according to the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
38.

	This story can be found in John 5:1-18.  People were upset that Jesus healed him on the Sabbath. The Sabbath for Jewish people is on Saturday; it starts at sundown on Friday as the Jewish day begins at night.

questions.text: What body part was withered on the man Jesus healed, according to the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
Hand.

	This can be found in Matthew 12:9-13, Mark 3:1-6 and Luke 6:6-11. He also healed this man on the Sabbath. The Pharisees were ready to accuse him of sinning. Jesus asked them in Mark 3:4 "Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil? to save life, or to kill?" They did not reply.

questions.text: According to the King James Version, what did Jesus say to the leper who said, "Lord if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean"?
options: I will but not right now.
questions.explanation:
I will. Be thou clean.

	This can be found in Matthew 8:1-4. He touched the leper and he was instantly healed. It was unheard of for anyone to touch a leper as they were considered unclean.

questions.text: According to the King James version, when Jesus healed the ten lepers how many thanked Him?
questions.explanation:
1.

	This can be found in Luke 17:11-19. Traditionally Jews and Samaritans stayed away from each other. However, in John 4 Jesus converses with the woman at the well who was also Samaritan.

questions.text: How long had the woman been bleeding when Jesus healed her, according to the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
12 years.

	This can be found in Matthew 9:20-22, Mark 5:25-34 and Luke 8:43-48.  She touched Him on the edge of his cloak In Mark 5:34 Jesus said to her, "Daughter, thy faith, hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague."

questions.text: Whose daughter was raised from the dead, according to the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
Jairus.

	This can be found in Matthew 9:20-22, Mark 5:25-34 and Luke 8:49-56. He told Jairus, "Fear not: believe only and she shall be made whole." Everyone was crying because the girl died. Jesus told them she was only sleeping. Then he told her to rise and she did.

questions.text: According to the King James Version, another person healed from his death was Lazarus. Who were his sisters?
questions.explanation:
Mary and Martha.

	This can be found in John 11:1-44. Lazarus had been dead four days when he was raised. This was Jesus' last miracle  before His own death, burial and resurrection.
